result.execSummary:
The defendant Dion T Pearson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision for the sentence now being served.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so).
Consecutive to: To any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dion T Pearson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 7  MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence.  
- 6 months driver license revocation
- pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision for the sentence now being served.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- provide a DNA sample (if not already done so)

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Dion T Pearson in court with Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Dion T Pearson in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders penalty enhancer (Repeater) DISMISSED.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of the amended charge and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz in court, defendant Dion T Pearson not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment.

Parties are informed that effective December 14, 2015, this matter will be assigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders, Room 629 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz in court, defendant Dion T Pearson not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to time constraints, matter adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz in court, defendant Dion T Pearson not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dion T Pearson in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Dion T Pearson in custody.  James Frisch for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Robert Smith-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dion T Pearson in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Dion T Pearson in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Dion T Pearson
Current: 2434 W Medford Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 09-13-2015)
Prior: 1958C North 20th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
